obvious.jdbc.data
Class JDBCObviousTable

java.lang.Object
  obvious.jdbc.data.JDBCObviousTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
obvious.data.Data, obvious.data.Table, obvious.util.Adaptable
public class JDBCObviousTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements obvious.data.Table

This class is an implementation of the Obvious Table interface based on JDBC. It could be normally used with all JDBC drivers and has been tested with Oracle and MySQL JDBC drivers. To create a Table instance, it simply needs to have the parameters to create a JDBC connection and a Table name. All Obvious methods are translated into SQL commands in order to implement them through JDBC. This Obvious data structure can be used as a "traditional" Obvious implementation based on an InfoVis toolkit.

Author:
Pierre-Luc Hemery
See Also:

                        java.lang.String tName,
                        java.lang.String inKeyColumn)
Constructor for an Obvious table based on JDBC.

Parameters:
inSchema - an Obvious schema
driver - driver for the database (JDBC)
inUrl - URL to access to the database
inUsername - user name to access to the database
inPswd - password to access to the database
tName - table name
inKeyColumn - name of column used as a primary key

JDBCObviousTable

public JDBCObviousTable(obvious.data.Schema inSchema,
                        java.lang.String driver,
                        java.lang.String inUrl,
                        java.lang.String inUsername,
                        java.lang.String inPswd,
                        java.lang.String tName)
                 throws obvious.ObviousException
Constructor for an Obvious table based on JDBC. This constructor tries to resolve itself the primary key of the Table.

Parameters:
inSchema - an Obvious schema
driver - driver for the database (JDBC)
inUrl - URL to access to the database
inUsername - user name to access to the database
inPswd - password to access to the database
tName - table name
Throws:
obvious.ObviousException - when obvious table creation failed

tableExist

public boolean tableExist()
Checks if the table already exist in the database.

Returns:
true if table already created

getPrimaryKey

public static java.lang.String getPrimaryKey(java.lang.String inDriver,
                                             java.lang.String inUrl,
                                             java.lang.String inUser,
                                             java.lang.String inPswd,
                                             java.lang.String tName)
                                      throws obvious.ObviousException
Gets the attribute primaryKey. Fails if the table has zero or two or more columns as primary key.

Parameters:
inDriver - driver for the JDBC database
inUrl - URL to access to the database
inUser - user name to access to the database
inPswd - password to access to the database
tName - table name
Returns:
name of the column used as primary key.
Throws:
obvious.ObviousException - if table has zero or two (more) columns for PK.

canAddRow

public boolean canAddRow()
Indicates if it is possible to add a row in this table. If a column or the database is readOnly, the implementation assumes it is impossible to add a row.

Specified by:
canAddRow in interface obvious.data.Table
Returns:
true if possible
